revised_title: Anatomical Observations on the Posterior Lobes of the Cerebrum in Quadrumana
tldr: The author examines the posterior lobes of the cerebrum in various Quadrumana species and compares their structure to the human brain. The study focuses on the development of the lateral ventricles and the presence of the posterior cornu and hippocampus minor, which are found to be more developed in some species than in humans.
